intro: Muehlenbeckia urubambensis, commonly known as the Andean muhly, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its slender, grass-like stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. It produces tiny, wind-pollinated flowers that develop into small, dry fruits. Muehlenbeckia urubambensis is known for its resilience to arid conditions and is often found in high-altitude regions.
